channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Some farmers lobby for more federal support as others lose faith in the government
item.description: Despite the Trump administration's recent $12 billion bailout, a turbulent year is prompting some farmers to question their reliance on government assistance and programs.
item.content:encoded: Despite the Trump administration's recent $12 billion bailout, a turbulent year is prompting some farmers to question their reliance on government assistance and programs.
item.dc:creator: Anusha Mathur

item.title: How a VA social worker's life has changed since leaving the job
item.description: The upheaval to the federal workforce in 2025 drove tens of thousands of federal employees to leave their jobs. One former employee of the Veterans Health Administration reflects on the year.
item.content:encoded: The upheaval to the federal workforce in 2025 drove tens of thousands of federal employees to leave their jobs. One former employee of the Veterans Health Administration reflects on the year.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Search continues for killer of Brown University students
item.description: Officials continue to investigate the fatal shootings of two students at Brown University in Providence, Rhode Island. We'll have an update on the search for a suspect.
item.content:encoded: Officials continue to investigate the fatal shootings of two students at Brown University in Providence, Rhode Island. We'll have an update on the search for a suspect.
item.dc:creator: David Wright

item.title: The latest on the investigation into the deaths of Rob and Michelle Reiner
item.description: The son of Hollywood director Rob and Michelle Reiner has been arrested on suspicion of murder related to their deaths.
item.content:encoded: The son of Hollywood director Rob and Michelle Reiner has been arrested on suspicion of murder related to their deaths.
item.dc:creator: Steve Futterman

item.title: Washington, D.C., makes kiss-story with record number of couples under mistletoe
item.description: Washington, D.C., set a world record of most couples kissing underneath the mistletoe. Exactly 1,435 couples turned up to smooch for five seconds under the festive greenery on Saturday.
item.content:encoded: Washington, D.C., set a world record of most couples kissing underneath the mistletoe. Exactly 1,435 couples turned up to smooch for five seconds under the festive greenery on Saturday.
item.dc:creator: Elena Burnett

item.title: Australia announces strict new gun laws. Here's how it can act so swiftly
item.description: Less than 48 hours after the deadly attack at Sydney's Bondi Beach that left more than a dozen dead, Australian authorities announced proposals for sweeping new gun laws.
item.content:encoded:
Less than 48 hours after the deadly attack at Sydney's Bondi Beach that left more than a dozen dead, Australian authorities announced proposals for sweeping new gun laws.

(Image credit: Izhar Khan)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Executions nearly double in 2025 due to dramatic rise in Florida
item.description: This year, 48 people are expected to be executed in the U.S. Meanwhile, fewer new death sentences are being issued, and public support for the death penalty is at its lowest point in over 50 years.
item.content:encoded:
This year, 48 people are expected to be executed in the U.S. Meanwhile, fewer new death sentences are being issued, and public support for the death penalty is at its lowest point in over 50 years.

(Image credit: Sue Ogrocki)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Brian Walshe, who searched for crime tips online, is convicted of his wife's murder
item.description: Walshe said his wife left town for a work emergency in January 2023. Investigators found items like a hacksaw, bloody rugs and her COVID vaccine card in dumpsters — and chilling searches on his devices.
item.content:encoded:
Walshe said his wife left town for a work emergency in January 2023. Investigators found items like a hacksaw, bloody rugs and her COVID vaccine card in dumpsters — and chilling searches on his devices.

(Image credit: Greg Derr)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: 15 killed in mass shooting in Sydney. And, Rob Reiner and his wife found dead
item.description: Here's what we know about the mass shooting that left at least 15 people dead. And, authorities found director Rob Reiner and his wife, Michele, dead in their Los Angeles home.
item.content:encoded:
Here's what we know about the mass shooting that left at least 15 people dead. And, authorities found director Rob Reiner and his wife, Michele, dead in their Los Angeles home.

(Image credit: Izhar Khan)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Police to release 'person of interest' in Brown University mass shooting
item.description: Officials are still searching for the gunman who opened fire at Brown University Saturday, killing two people and injuring nine. Police are releasing a man who was held as a person of interest.
item.content:encoded: Officials are still searching for the gunman who opened fire at Brown University Saturday, killing two people and injuring nine. Police are releasing a man who was held as a person of interest.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez
